    • Constructor Detail

      • DriveManagerImpl

        public DriveManagerImpl(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotDrive drive,
                        edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.RobotBase base,
                        SimGyro gyro,
                        edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Encoder leftEncoder,
                        edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Encoder rightEncoder,
                        EJoystick stick)
        Initializes a DriveManagerImpl. This class is an implementation of the interface DriveManager and can be used to drive the robot via turning or driving straight. If a certain piece of hardware is unavailable, the correct action is to pass in its associated object as null, and an exception will be thrown if the associated functionality is requested. In the case of encoders, passing in one as null will cause the other to be used as the sole encoder. Passing in both as null will indicate that there is no encoder functionality on the robot (i.e. the robot cannot drive straight reliably).
        Parameters:
        drive - The RobotDrive object associated with the drive train.
        base - An object representing the running robot code and its state. Used to check if movement loops should bail out.
        gyro - The gryoscope on the robot used for turning.
        leftEncoder - The encoder on the "left" side of the robot. Passing this in as null will cause the other (right) encoder to be assumed as the only one.
        rightEncoder - The encoder on the "right" side of the robot. Passing this in as null will cause the other (left) encoder to be assumed as the only one.
        stick - The EJoystick to use to drive the robot

    • Method Detail

        public void driveStraight(int units)
        Description copied from interface: DriveManager
        Uses a PID controller to drive straight units of whatever units we were calibrated to.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        units - Number of units to drive forward. Determined by calibration.

      • driveTurn

        public void driveTurn(int degrees)
        Description copied from interface: DriveManager
        Turns degrees degrees to the left when degrees is negative and to the right when degrees is positive. TODO: Check if left and right turns are actually always negative and positive respectively.
        Specified by:
        driveTurn in interface DriveManager
        Parameters:
        degrees - The number of degrees to turn

      • arcadeDrive

        public void arcadeDrive()
        Description copied from interface: DriveManager
        Drive using arcade drive. This means that the joystick will be used so that the y axis (up and down on the joystick) will move the robot forward and backwards and the x axis (left and right on the joystick) will spin the robot left and right.
        Specified by:
        arcadeDrive in interface DriveManager

      • runCalibration

        public void runCalibration()
        Description copied from interface: DriveManager
        Runs a calibration routine to set the encoder distance per pulse.
        Specified by:
        runCalibration in interface DriveManager
